author: Tara Fatemi Walker
title: Quick Bites | Santa Cruz Greek Festival on deck
description: The annual Live Like a Greek Festival is in the courtyard of Prophet Elias Greek Orthodox Church this weekend. There will be Greek food for sale including souvlaki (lamb, pork, or chicken skewers), gyros, lamb-rice meatballs, spanakopita, and Greek salad. Desserts include baklava and several other handmade pastries, and drinks include Greek wine, beer and Greek coffee.

author: Laura Daily and Bryan K. Chavez
title: Free and cheap things to do in metro Denver in September
description: Micheladas, fall festivals and free coffee are all on the list.

author: Rachel Keck
title: When Farmhouse Coffee plans to ‘launch the bean’ in Gainesville
description: Downtown Gainesville’s list of places to get a coffee fix keeps on growing.

author: Jak Connor
title: Scientists discover incredible use for coffee grounds that everyone can do
description: Researchers in Australia have discovered a nice practical option for coffee grounds instead of throwing them out and adding to landfill problems. Continue reading at TweakTown >

author: Josh Wright
title: Costa unveils plans for new drive-thru in Portsmouth at the Pompey Centre
description: Coffee chain Costa has earmarked the Pompey Centre for its latest Portsmouth outlet.

title: Coffee Briefing Sept. 5 – IBM, Salesforce team up; CCTS reinstates ICA Microsystems; Government of Canada invests in EV parts manufacturer; and more
description: Coffee Briefings are timely deliveries of the latest ITWC headlines, interviews, and podcasts. Today’s Coffee Briefing is delivered by IT World Canada’s editorial team! Missed last week’s Coffee Briefing? We’ve got you covered. author: Kate Bradshaw, John Metcalfe, Linda Zavoral
title: 6 Bay Area sports bars to suit every type of football fan
description: Watching your favorite team score as you laze on the couch -- or jump up and down on your coffee table -- isn't a bad thing. But isn't it more fun to cheer on the game in the company of fellow fans?

author: Gary Stern, Contributor
title: Fellini’s Coffee Bar: Just A Tiny Fraction Of Indoor Space But Drawing A Crowd
description: Every restaurateur in Manhattan recognizes that space is at a premium, can be very costly, and often forces start-ups to cram into tiny spaces. And then there’s Fellini Coffee Bar, which opened on July 14th in the West Village on a triangular corner of 7th Avenue, Waverly Place and Perry Street and measures a mere l6 square feet of indoor space. It has no indoor seating, but somehow or other, two employees work in this tight, cramped space, one taking orders and the barista who makes the Italian coffee. It accommodates about 20 seats outdoor, looking like a café that belongs in Italy. Its co...

author: Simon Taylor
title: Melbourne, you’re great. But here’s what you need to learn from other Aussie cities
description: Our neighbours prove Melbourne still has a way to go if we want to be known for more than just our coffee, Spring racing and hipster-brewed beers.

author: Emily Chan
title: It’s Pumpkin Spice Season, And It’s Actually Nothing New, Since It’s Been Around For 3,500 Years
description: When the iconic pumpkin spice lattes start to pop back up on the Starbucks menus, you know that fall is right around the corner. The pumpkin spice trend seems to be fairly recent. However, pumpkin spice has roots beyond its modern association with coffee. In fact, pumpkin spice has been around for 3,500 years! So, […]

author: Katharina Buczek
title: From Playdates To Coffee Dates: How To Connect And Find Some Mom Friends
description: In between diaper changes, playdates, and sleepless nights, finding friends in the same stage of life who can relate to your daily hustle might seem impossible. But parenting doesn’t have to feel lonely, and you no longer have to feel like you’re going insane listening to YouTube Kids constantly streaming your TV. The key to […]

author: Rebecca Meyer
title: His Wife Dumped Coffee All Over His Brother’s Bratty Stepdaughter After Nobody Tried To Correct Her Atrocious Attitude
description: This 34-year-old man and his wife, also 34, are child-free. One year ago, his brother Mack, 28, began a relationship with Heather, 30. Heather has three children from a previous relationship. She has a 12-year-old daughter named Anna and two sons who are 6 and 8-years-old. Heather’s sons are well-behaved. Anna, however, is another story. […]
